_meta.description: Configuration for detecting bot-like input patterns (mouse/keyboard behavior analysis)

_explanation.how_it_works: The detector polls mouse and keyboard input at high frequency, then analyzes patterns to calculate a bot-likelihood score (0-100). Lower variance in timing = more bot-like.

key_metrics.IKI: Inter-Keystroke Interval - time between key presses. Bots have very consistent timing.
key_metrics.ICI: Inter-Click Interval - time between mouse clicks. Bots have very consistent timing.
key_metrics.CV: Coefficient of Variation (stddev/mean). Lower = more consistent = more bot-like. Humans typically have CV > 0.20
key_metrics.Constant Velocity: Mouse moves at same speed. Humans vary speed naturally.
key_metrics.Direction Variability: How straight mouse paths are. Bots move in perfect lines.

data_collection._description: How often and how much input data to collect

bot_detection_thresholds._description: Thresholds for detecting bot-like behavior. Lower values = stricter detection.

keyboard_timing._description: Inter-Keystroke Interval (IKI) coefficient of variation thresholds
keyboard_timing._human_typical: Humans typically have CV > 0.20 (20% variation in typing speed)

click_timing._description: Inter-Click Interval (ICI) coefficient of variation thresholds
click_timing._human_typical: Humans typically have CV > 0.20 (20% variation in click timing)

mouse_movement._explanation: constant_velocity = fraction of movements with same speed. straight_line = direction variability (lower = straighter)

reaction_time._description: Minimum human reaction time in milliseconds
reaction_time._explanation: Reactions faster than 140ms are physically impossible for humans

click_position._explanation: Bots often click exact same pixels repeatedly. Humans have natural variance.

jitter._explanation: Humans have natural hand tremor. Very low jitter suggests synthetic input.

scoring_weights._description: How many points each detection adds to the bot score (max 100)
